name: Baked Macaroni Cheese with Chicken & BROCCOLI
description: EASY baked Mac and Cheese loaded with chicken and broccoli - a COMPLETE meal all made in one pot! This recipe requires the specific ratio of water, milk and macaroni that I've specified in the recipe. Don't be alarmed at how much liquid there is when you take it out of the oven before broiling/grilling the top. You will be surprised how quickly the liquid evaporates into a thick sauce. Watch the VIDEO to see how easy this is to make!
recipeIngredient: 1 lb / 500g   skinless chicken breast or thigh fillets (, cut into bite size pieces)
1  large head of broccoli (, broken into florets (or 1 1/2 smaller ones))
1 1/2 - 2 cups grated cheese ((cheddar, tasty or gruyere))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a deep heavy based skillet or dutch oven over high heat. Add chicken and cook until just cooked - it's fine if it's still raw inside. Remove chicken into a bowl. (Note 2)
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a deep heavy based skillet or dutch oven over high heat. Add chicken and cook until just cooked - it's fine if it's still raw inside. Remove chicken into a bowl. (Note 2)

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to medium and melt butter. Add garlic and onion and saute for 5 minutes until onion is translucent. Add flour and cook for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce heat to medium and melt butter. Add garlic and onion and saute for 5 minutes until onion is translucent. Add flour and cook for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in half the milk and whisk it in so the flour butter mixture melts. It should thicken quite quickly - around 30 seconds. Pour the remaining milk in, whisking constantly, then add the water, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in half the milk and whisk it in so the flour butter mixture melts. It should thicken quite quickly - around 30 seconds. Pour the remaining milk in, whisking constantly, then add the water, salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn the heat up to medium high and cook, whisking occasionally, for around 3 to 5 minutes until you start seeing steam rising from the white sauce when you whisk it.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn the heat up to medium high and cook, whisking occasionally, for around 3 to 5 minutes until you start seeing steam rising from the white sauce when you whisk it.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the macaroni and chicken, stir, then top with broccoli.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the macaroni and chicken, stir, then top with broccoli.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the lid on and bake for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the lid on and bake for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven, switch oven to broiler/grill on high.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven, switch oven to broiler/grill on high.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove lid (Note 3), stir through cheese, then sprinkle over panko and parmesan. (Will still look bit watery at this stage).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove lid (Note 3), stir through cheese, then sprinkle over panko and parmesan. (Will still look bit watery at this stage).

recipeInstructions.text: Place pot under the broiler/grill for 5 minutes, or until top is golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Place pot under the broiler/grill for 5 minutes, or until top is golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove, then let it stand for 5 minutes before serving (sauce thickens quickly).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove, then let it stand for 5 minutes before serving (sauce thickens quickly).

review.reviewBody: This was so good!! I usually find baked mac and cheese to be way too dry, but this was perfect, still saucy and flavorful. I baked the broccoli on a separate sheet pan so I could keep it on the side for my picky child, and mixed it in at the end for the rest of us. Delicious!
As per Lisaâ€™s comment below I used leftover juiciest roast chicken too. It was quick, easy and absolutely delicious!

This was delicious, quick and easy! I used left over roast chicken that needed using up (it was already cooked, so I just stirred it into the pasta right before putting it under the grill). It was perfect!

Amazing!! Super easy to make and delicious! I made the sauce and followed the first steps in a pot on my stove then transferred the sauce to a glass Pyrex and added the noodles, etc. I was nervous since the noodles weren't cooked before the Pyrex but it literally did turn out PERFECT and delicious! Thank you!

Delicious quick and easy! Cooking your recipes has made me enjoy cooking again after having children and catering to a family. Everything just works and I love that the measurements and ingredients are all Australian and all of the practical tips!

Hi Nagi, 

Thank you so much for, yet again, another stellar recipe! Such a wonderful and delicious comfort-food meal. Perfect dish for the deep-freeze weâ€™re experiencing (-20c) in British Columbia right now! I did have to keep it in the oven for about 35 minutes as the pasta wasnâ€™t done at the 20 minute mark. No biggie, though. This is a total keeper and has earned a top spot in the meal rotation! Thanks again, Nagi!
